It's a strange thing to articulate, and those who have had that kind of connection know precisely what I'm talking about. To those who can't pinpoint that kind of connection (if you have to think hard about it, you've probably never had one), you're in for one soon.Richard Linklater's Before Sunrise, which kickstarted a trilogy that spanned the course of three separate decades and analyzed Linklater's favorite cinematic idea, time, is an ode to that kind of comfortable, life-affirming connection we all should experience. Linklater thankfully devotes an entire film to that kind of connection, making a film entirely focused on characters rather than the events, the location, or the supporting characters surrounding them. It's as if Linklater got fed up at watching interesting characters, their motivations and their potentials, in other films squandered so other, more trivial matters could be attended to. In Before Sunrise, he strips down everything to two central characters and their views on a variety of different issues, philosophical ideas, and past experiences.Those two characters are Jesse and Céline (Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy), who, from the moment they meet on a train-car from Budapest heading to Vienna, they reveal personal details and personal opinions on love, romance, and just their general upbringings. When Jesse's stop at Vienna finally rolls around, he convinces Céline to hop off the train with him, to which she throws caution to the wind and obliges. The two divulge in a great deal of personal matters together; he is a romantic soul masquerading as a cynic after breaking up with his girlfriend, the whole reason he's in Vienna in the first place, and she has fallen before and is cautious about doing so again. The two, however, recognize their separate agendas and treat this night as their one and only encounter, leading them to get personal and loquacious with one-another while walking through the entire city.As stated, Linklater strips this film back a plethora of layers to simply being about these two characters. Linklater even limits pictorial distractions, as the two characters walking through the city of Vienna leaves for a great deal of possibility to stumble upon something distracting. That occurs, if I remember correctly, once in the film, and it's incorporated so well into the discussion and the flow that you're bound to miss it. It's no lie that Linklater has seriously found himself committed to making this project about this simple yet unbelievably affecting kind of connection, which, in this case, transcends personal bounds into becoming romantic, leading the characters to question how they feel and how they want to proceed.Hawke and Delpy, I feel, aren't doing much acting here; part of me feels they're conveying their own kind of presences to one another and that there's little effort required on their part to change who they are or become something they are not. The film also bears the necessary pacing element of being lax and carefree, never rushing these characters onto the next setup nor making them take detours for comedy's sake. This is Linklater driving the truck down a path that has many different routes and he chooses the most direct route, and simultaneously, the most beautiful and mystifying.Before Sunrise beautifully illustrates the power of human connection through two strong performers and a writer/director obsessed with the impact and idea of time and the realism and the aforementioned kind of connection. Here, he displays his affinity and talent for both through a film that is equal parts contemplative in a philosophical sense and also incredibly beautiful on a human scale. This is a romantic comedy for people who have grown sick and tired of falsified, picturesque romantic comedies and hunger for something genuine, real, and lasting, much like the impact of these characters' relationship with one another in the film.Starring: Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy. Directed by: Richard Linklater.

title: Good
content: The film is not as enthusiastic as the first, but its last half hour is enough for the purpose The film is a dialogue in a way that makes you excited to watch. The dialogues are legendary, and how the period of separation is reflected in these dialogues is wonderful. The film shows me how the way of thinking changes as one grows older, but in the end the essence of the heart remains the same I also liked that the ending was open and that its content was present in the dialogues and expected Of course, in the end, this is a romantic movie, and romantic love stories happen to a few people, but we always hope to be one of them.

title: Strong moments stay for a lifetime
content: I watched the movie after so many years I had it in mind. It was a reminder of the strong feelings that occur between two people with enormous chemistry. I hope anyone in his life would be lucky enough to feel such connection and excitement and love(?) regardless the pain when they realise that life has other plans. This is one reason worth living. The magic.

title: In a word: beautiful!
content: There is something really great about Richard Linklater and his movies. Every film he does feels like a light being thrown on life and it's subtleties. He creates these heartwarming worlds using just the routine life.Before Sunrise is one of the most beautiful movies one can ever see, and yet it doesn't submits to any of the conventional beauty prerequisites. It's so good because it's so simple. The story follows an American boy and a French girl, traveling on the same train, who get engaged in a conversation and then decide to spend a night together walking around the beautiful city of Vienna. For a story that simple, the way the film builds up its romantic elements is truly blissful.It's also a wonderful character study and most of the times it uses dialogues to do so. Jesse and Celine converse their hearts out without ever being melodramatic or overly sentimental. Watching a completely natural looking talk unfold on the screen is endearing.The camera work, like the screenplay, is gentle. There's one scene in particular, when they both are listening to some record in a listening booth, looking at one another and trying not to be caught doing so, which shows the sexual attraction between the two in a calmest and the most delicate demeanor possible. The slight low angle and congestion of the space adds so much to the scene.This film truly captures romance in an entirely new perspective. It's like finding the romance in the tiny bits of the life bereft of the age old phony augmentations of the subtle emotion.

title: Best realism Romance film
content: The before trilogy is some of the best movie work surrounding romance, it doesn't hold back on different perspectives of love and doesn't spoon feed you nonsense that most romance movies hold today. The film is literally two people talking about love and other things in life and yet it's one of the most intellectual and entertaining pieces of media made. They have real conversations through the movie making them more connected to us and caring for the relationship the are building with one another. The writing must've been really strong as this film is so fantastic and real, aswell as great performances from the two protagonists. It's very relatable too which makes it even better, there is tons that you can relate to and they will discuss it in such a complex and intelligent way. The visuals in the film are also good showing off what the story is in subtle ways and showcasing the beautiful city of Vienna too. It talks about life a lot but the main thing is love and it shows and tells us what is love and what makes it real, it's different emotions surrounding love and most importantly is the complexity of what they talk about. It's difficult to express just how good the dialogue is as there is so much to dissect from it all but it's fantastic and a rare realism movie. One of the best romance movies of all time.

title: It is what it is
content: This was the first of what became the 'Before' trilogy, three rambling and romantic films starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy.I think this is a film you'll either love or hate, purely because of the style of film it is. There is very little plot, and is very talky instead. That's fine if you're a fan of big powerful speeches, and poetic language, but if you're waiting for a 'big moment' then you're going to be disappointed.I enjoyed this film, I thought it was without doubt a clever film, but I can't say it enticed me enough to make me watch it again, or to see the subsequent sequels.

title: Astonishingly Beautiful Love Story
content: "Isn't everything we do in life a way to be loved a little more?"The movie was on my bucket list for a long time (the trilogy). At first I thought that it is one of those typical boy-meets-girl love stories but as it moves forward, it proved me wrong. At certain part you will realize that this isn't just a movie or a love story, rather a realization of life, of love, of how you see the world and the people from different aspects. It's like those never ending late night conversations that you always wanted to have with someone. Brilliant acting and direction, not to mention the precious dialogues. The chemistry between Ethan and Julie felt so real. A must watch for everyone.

title: Delightful in every way.
content: I seen this movie after experiencing my first real relationship ending, and man did it have a effect on me. The stages of developing intimacy between two strangers just felt so real while watching this film. It was not over exaggerated at all and never seemed phony in anyway, all I seemed to fell was that I was watching two young people enjoying each others company and in result forming some sort of a relationship. The chemistry between Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy is just breath taking, with the seemed to be improvised dialogue and the (seeming real at the time) sexual tension between the two characters just was honest in delivery. I can't see any faults in this movie and is, in my mind, the greatest romance film I've ever seen.

title: A extremely, beautiful, good, artsy and deep film! A unique romantic film. A must see!
content: A relaxed, intelligent, smart, emotional, authentic, deep, well performed and great and very beautiful written and poetic film about human desire, dreams, ambition and love.A unique romantic film. A new input into the ordinary romantic film. A film that truly sticks out.Cinematography, filming and music is very good and beautiful!Acting is fantastic by every actor and feels very genuine!A film also exploring modern philosophy and existential questions. Its a film focusing heavily on life and death, relationships and its consequences aswell the meaning of life.Richard Linklater gives another great, funny, beautiful, wholesome and artsy film with a interesting perspective of human relationships and love and romance itself.A must see! I really recommend it! Pure Art! Beautiful!

title: Real and beautiful and fantastic.
content: There is a sense of realism in this movie which was brought in by the actors. They did a phenomenal job. The direction is flawless because it's based on a real life story of the director and he's done a fabulous job making the actors portray it realistically.The dialogue in this film is real good. Nothing corny, no cheesy lines, just real and mature. It's nothing like I've seen before. Super story and even the cinematography is fantastic.I absolutely love this film. One of the best Romance movies ever made.

title: Before Sunrise
content: A wonderful movie depicting Love, circumstances leading to love. What a miracle love is??? Love can only be related to Time. Love can happen at any destination be it a train, bus or road. Before Sunrise has some wonderful dialogues, two beautiful actors and a wonderful director Mr. Linklater. Before Sunrise also shows how much thinking of a Man and a Woman can differ with some wonderfully choreographed scenes. It inspires me to keep hoping and waiting for the right time. Lastly a picturesque location Vienna. A must watch for all Romantic movie lovers, Not only just this particular film but the whole Before series. Before Sunrise also depicts the mundane day to day life and how a single night with your most precious person is so much precious. I personally loved it.

title: The best romantic movie
content: Even though I've mentioned it as the best romantic film, for me, it's simply the best film ever. It's also the only film I've ever rated 10/10. The magic of the Before series lies in the fact that the 9-year gaps between the films also happen in real life, which allows the audience to grow with it, take it in as part of their life, and be immersed in its flow. We witness three stages throughout the series. The first film has tones of romance and youth, where everything feels rosy, and we bask in the essence of life's joy, moving forward with a sense of carefree delight and excitement. In the second film, we face the harsh reality of life. Life's truths begin to intervene, showing that we aren't the only ones making plans. A sweet reunion brings out what has been left unsaid, but it's not enough. They are no longer young nor completely free. Yet, hope lingers, and romance ultimately triumphs. By the third film, concepts like romance, passion, and desire give way to love, effort, responsibility, sacrifice, and tolerance. Life has become tougher, but it is within these challenges that its beauty emerges. The final scene leaves us with a range of emotions and thoughts, as we too experience this brief display of life before it concludes. While a part of you may yearn for a fourth film, another part appreciates that its absence enhances the series' completeness and leaves a pleasant aftertaste. What needed to happen has happened.

title: 90's were better 🎬🍿
content: I watched this today for the first time in years, I've always loved this film. It was one of my favourites as a movie obsessed kid at the video shop, sucker for a bit of whimsical-ness and romance. When they announced a second I was so excited, then the final one in the trilogy which is also a long time ago now. I just love the vibe of the film so great.Whenever I feel like I am missing the world and just everything before technology and the whole fake world of social media and over sharing took over, I refer to my feel good films growing up to take me back to those times! Which feels like I need to do a lot of lately. Best feeling.This totally hit the spot for me today, and of course you see things slightly differently again and again which is always the beauty of re-watching or re-reading your favs over the years.Hate to say it but it's before everyone seemingly turned crazy and the younger generations sadly will just never get that that's like, true authenticity. Living in the moment, not wasting their imaginations and potential stuck in dopamine phone and tech addictions. Filling their brains with just so much stimulation and stupid things. Just simply missing out on the real world. Before everyone looked like a freak show and the same as each other, with the beauty industry, they just don't realise they all look insane with their huge lips and their seeming perceived ideas of 'perfection' they are chasing and whatever.... Letting things happen without the need to share and ruining sacred special moments, real connections. Though in saying that, I do have faith in the younger generations to come with their open mindedness, they just need to watch their egos and put down their phones more often and not get carried away with too much rubbish and just be real. They all have a unique sense of humour which is a good thing.... I think why some of them are starting to gravitate and mimick now what they see in the 90's and other decades before and 90's coming back in to fashion is because they can feel the realness and they like it, because they are so used to the opposite and deep down they are realising how things are in the world now simply isn't okay, this review took a unexpected turn haha.90's were better 🎥🍿🎬Though I'm sure those from generations before me could say much the same, however 90's truely were the best. Woman had a say, things were just different, the last generation who came of age without all the smart phones and social media etcAnyhoo thats my random 2 cents worth of ramble!

title: I can really watch them talk like that for the rest of my life!
content: Before Sunrise.A young man and woman meet on a train in Europe, and wind up spending one evening together in Vienna. Unfortunately, both know that this will probably be their only night together.Before Sunrise was the perfect movie for me to reconsider watching romance once again, this is how it should be made a perfect real romance a very refreshing one.It's about a first date, a fist night that can be the last and what can gather a man and a women on a single night besides having those beautiful spontaneous discussion about life, past and future .Sometimes talking about some philosophical matters and it's ridiculously funny and it does happen every time, talking about things the other one probably doesn't have to do with and it's still cool you're both having a great time .Before Sunrise is a great refreshing movie, Julie Delpy was beautiful and her chemistry with Ethan Hawke was beautiful too.I almost forgot to mention the writing that was absolutely well-made.

title: Before Sunrise is the romantic movie which we all wanted to see
content: Before Sunrise is an romantic drama movie directed by Richard Linklater and stars Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy.Two strangers from different parts of the world meets on a train journey and decides to spend a day together at Vienna. A great plot, great execution, perfect screenplay, natural and authentic acting and a great ending this is Before Sunrise all about is.There are many people whom we meets only once in a lifetime but how many of them we actually remembers. The movie portrays the relationship between two strangers who is now willing to spend some time together with great perfection and instead of showing them to going to a disco or some amusement park or doing party the director had put focus more on their informal talks about their likes and dislikes, their past, their family and friends which we all might do.Screenplay of the movie is great and gripping, the movie is a story of only a day so the movie might feel slow to some viewers but that's the real beauty and the movie is all about.Acting is supeb and both Ethan Hawke and Julie Delphy were very real and natural in their roles. Climax of the movie is good and gives a perfect ending to the movie, for me this is one of the most lovely and touching movie. A must watch for all romantic movie lovers.

title: Real moments, captured
content: The dialogue in this movie felt so real, the angst, the excitement, particularly that scene in the record shop... It really felt like we were following real people having real conversations and thats something that's hard to come by in films. Loved this movie.

title: Seen it before, once is enough!
content: Having seen this movie once before I was excited to watch it again. I remembered enjoying the dialogue, characters, and uniqueness of the plot. However, it is not good. It really isn't. This is a bad movie. It doesn't capture my attention, I'm bored, the dialogue though good, isn't enough. Perhaps this is the perfect movie for hopeless romantics who have nothing better to do than watch sappy movies. For a romantic comedy this movie leans far too much towards the romantic and far to little towards the comedy. The awkward interactions and revealing moments, the silences that say so much are all very real, but am I having a good time watching this? No. Will I come away from this with anything? No. The only reason I can understand someone watching this is because they have recently had their heart broken or are trying to get into a girls pants. As far as the former is concerned-this movie won't mend your broken heart. And for the latter-she decided before the movie started whether or not you were getting any, so don't waste your time or hers.

title: Before Sunrise, Perfect Romance!
content: Among all the romance movies I have seen, "Before Sunrise" remains the best. The plot is exotic in itself. It relies on the simplicity of its characters in terms of behavior and appearance. If you love philosophical dialogue like me, this movie is for you! The story is about a young amateur American writer, Jesse, who meets a young French lady, Celine, on a train trip. The young couple decides to stop in Vienna to enjoy one exotic night. The beauty of the movie is not limited to the complexity of the plot; it extends to the performance and the chemistry that the two protagonists could perfectly achieve. The movie takes you through a wonderful journey in three dimensions: philosophy, culture, and geography. The choice of Vienna as a setting is so fortunate because it matches the atmosphere of the move: exotic romance. I highly recommend this movie for a journey in space and time!

title: Interaction and connection under a magnifier
content:
I started off with the movie expecting not really that much, expected it to be another one of those romcoms that you can predict after 5 minutes of watching and you just end up texting through the whole thing just to see that in the end you were right. It wasn't. First I saw all the requirements for movie like this, and my thought were, okay here we go again. The longer I watched the more I started to love it. The way Linklater shows the interaction between the two is so spot-on. From the start all the details are just perfect. The way their interaction changes as they spend more time together is so subtle but again, spot-on. A great examination of human connection. So real it made me feel I was there, he really succeeds in transferred such intricate emotions. I have to be honest, the movie meets a lot of the requirements for romcom number 60239. But trust me, give it the benefit of the doubt and im sure the way these two are portrayed will draw you in and keep you fixated and interested till the end. (Was hoping for the same to happen in the next two movies in the series, but it didn't)
A beautiful and honest view on love and relationships.

title: "Isn't everything we do in life a way to be loved a little more?"
content: Two young people, an American boy and a French girl, accidentally meet on a Budapest-Vienna train, and spontaneously decide to postpone their final destinations for a while and spend the night in Vienna together."Before Sunrise" is a film with almost no events and the whole movie comes down to an all-night conversation between the two protagonists, during which they get closer and fall in love, although they are painfully aware that after sunrise they will probably never see each other again. The chemistry between Julie Delpy and Ethan Hawke is wonderful, and their relationship and conversations are so natural and spontaneous that they seem like improvisation. The film is so believable and life-like that I felt like a voyeur following two real lovers, spying from the sidelines. It is incredibly easy to identify with these characters, to recognize some of our own conversations in theirs, and the combination of the movie atmosphere and the memories it aroused left me with an impression that, as time goes on, only intensifies.8,5/10.

title: Good film
content: Good film. The movie portrays a day of two strangers' conversation. It started suddenly in a train and the conversation went on and on. The conversation turned to be the philosophies of two lives. The movie highlights the beautiful nature and night life of Vienna, Austria. There are tons of beautiful, memorable scenes which I would love to mention. The morning scene after the protagonists made out, the calm tone the director used, I don't no what magic he used, I could feel the exact morning freshness. The scene when they listened to Kath bloom's 'come here' inside a listening booth, that scene was one of my all time favorite movie scenes. Apart from that, there was train conversation, bus conversation, some random people's appearance and some other memorable scenes which will stay in my heart forever. I refer this film as a pure cinematic beauty. Great to see this movie finally made it to the top 250 list of IMDb.

title: Overrated, flat.
content: The movie is overrated and , basically, flat in the sense of nothing much happening. It is a 2 star movie, so beware. It started all right but it does not develop into anything worth excitement. I watched it because of its ranking in IMDb and I got burned.

title: Romantic in a real way
content: The most realistic yet poetic series of films, I'd recommend seeing all of them, with the first being of course the sweetest. They just talk about things, there are jokes, serious moments, deep moments, sweet moments and more, but most importantly it's about people being interested in something beyond themselves and finding each other.It doesn't need special effects or some incredible technology. It's all about writers creating a spectacle with script, clever filmmaking to create emotion and incredibly talented actors making us feel so many emotions. I haven't seen the female lead in anything else but she was confidently strong next to the male lead star.

title: Make me want find love
content: I watch this movie yesterday and today watch the others two. I am love about them, its AMAZING, amazing acting, amazing script, in all the 3 of them, its one of the most beautiful film of cinema, make me realize that no matter how time past, if something meant to be, will happen. I love them.

title: Lovely
content: This is basically an extended conversation between two people but it's kind of magical even though they occasionally say dumb or pretentious things (which totally works because they're young and awkward around each other.) If you don't feel a little twinge inside, you may not have a soul.

title: Mindful
content: As it's been stated by others. This is a beautiful and simplistic film which challenges us to think about our lives and explore our own thoughts. We have all known someone whom we shared a connection that was stronger than the situation called for. Beautiful and sensitive.

title: Never let the love of your life go
content: Never let go the love of your love. Well explained mesmerising movie ,after watching, i gurantee u are not gonna able to get it out of your head for quite sometimes. It's just the way the movie is made. It has some poetry ,some feelings and some situations.Never let go the love of your love. Well explained mesmerising movie ,after watching, i gurantee u are not gonna able to get it out of your head for quite sometimes. It's just the way the movie is made. It has some poetry ,some feelings and some situations. Never let go the love of your love. Well explained mesmerising movie ,after watching, i gurantee u are not gonna able to get it out of your head for quite sometimes. It's just the way the movie is made. It has some poetry ,some feelings and some situations.

title: Walk, talk and romance in Europe
content: Before Sunrise is a minimalist film which features Ethan Hawke and Julia Delpy as two young characters walking and talking.The film starts off in a train as a German couple argue and the two couple tentatively talk, enjoy each other's company and make an emotional connection.Both characters share their perspectives on life and love. The film takes place over the course of one day and night as they see shows, view buildings and gardens, drink in cafés and bars and become romantically entangled.They reveal maybe a little too much about themselves as believe they will never see one another again. Hawke has a plane to catch before sunrise as he returns to the USA while Delpy is going to Paris.The film has a charm with its Continental European setting but it's also easy to lose attention with all their talking.It does not quite fly for me although its a brave attempt by director and co-writer Richard Linklater to make an innovative, independent romantic film.However the film is intriguing because it has spawned two sequels so far. So we do meet the couple in the later stages of their lives.

title: This is just amazing in every aspect.
content: This is just amazing in every aspect. The dialog flows so smoothly and it seems so real that it's magic. It makes one believe that two people can really be in love with the purest of intentions.

title: before sunrise
content: For the most part co writer and director Richard Linklater manages to avoid the twin traps of Rohmerish boredom and Lelouche like sappiness in this unabashedly romantic film about two young people falling in love in Europe, through conversation. How does he manage it? Well, by knowing when to shift the focus from Jesse and Celine talking which, let's face it, can be didactic, especially when Jesse indulges a tendency toward philosophizing, to the lovely city of Vienna and its oddball, boho inhabitants. Also, both Julie Delpy and Ethan Hawke have the perfect mixture of star quality and acting skills that makes the viewer want both to gaze at them and be interested in them, as people. The result is a film that, while occasionally enervating, is funny, charming, touching and even, at times, poetic like when Delpy talks of the space between people where love and connections are either made or lost. A minus.

title: perfection in simplicity
content: This movie isn't like a lot of other romantic comedies or dramas. It isn't overly cluttered with subplots and pointless turns. It is a pure and simple story of falling in love and creating a deep bond with a complete stranger. After watching most romance movies, single viewers are left feeling more lonely than before, but Before Sunrise offers something different. It gives the viewer almost the exact opposite, a hope that somewhere out there in the world, there is a person that can complete you and understand you, and maybe one day you will cross paths. Even though the plot line is not particularly action-packed, it is so emotionally engaging. The movie is so successful in portraying the feeling of falling in love, in longing, loneliness, and pain in having to say goodbye. The simple blooming relationship between strangers is a beautiful picture of love and the human desire to connect on a deeper level with others. Even if you aren't a huge romance fan, Before Sunrise is definitely worth the watch.

title: Don't waste your money
content: Saw this piece of crap last month and I have one suggestion for all; don't waste your money to rent this piece of garbage. I really can't understand how anyone could enjoy this movie and have a hard time getting it through my head why it was made in the first place. As a matter of fact, I don't know why I'm wasting my time even talking about such a lousy movie. The main characters acting as if they an ounce of intelligence is not believable. The movie goes nowhere and all copies of this movie should be destroyed.......blaaagh!!!

title: A Realistic Film
content: For me when I watch a film I want something that has depth, a message, a gripping climax, a great ending, colorful characters, and sweeping dialogue. This film had that, and something that a lot of films especially romance ones today don't have, charm. I really felt compelled into both of the characters because not only were they super charismatic but they were real. They had feelings, and they cracked jokes and made fun of one another. They bonded over stories, talking about their interests, what makes them get up in the morning and experience life. These are real conversations that I wish we had more of today. Nowadays the dating world is so tough and everyone is moving a mile a minute and one of the key themes in this film I think is to stop and smell the roses. Life is going on right in front of you. Another way it felt so realistic was the super long takes and some editing tricks to help it look like almost one continuous shot. It was almost as if we were facing the characters and experiencing their love begin to bud as we were walking backwards witnessing it. This film moved me and made me tear up. I highly recommend it for not only entertainment, but also for insight into what true human connection looks like.

title: Just keep talking ,pls
content: I don't wanna talk about how this movie is a masterpiece. I don't wanna talk about the splendid direction and the mastery of cinematography. I really wanna express how much i love the dialogue, this is just awesome so many ideas, totally raises your cultural thinking ,promotes your conversation skills. For me it was reading a book than watching a movie .It's deep not like other shallow empty romance teenage movies that just flood love from every single part of them. It's not an "I love you" "I love you ,too" movie. It's a story and a conversation that add to you as human in your lifetime experience. Of course the acting was marvelous ,it is just Ethan Hawk <3. Long story short, a must seen masterpiece.

title: before sunrise
content: Paradise Lost tells the story that love cannot keep fresh. Two middle-aged men and women who cheated on each other in marriage commit suicide by taking poison when they loved each other most. They calculated the time so that the person who found them could not separate their bodies. It is the last song of love, the elegy of life. But if there is no helplessness around, derailed relatives do not understand the disappointment and even the bedside people's revenge, they will eventually come to this step? I don't think I can make it this far.BEFORE SUNRISE is also discussing about love, whether it is love at first sight, being together forever or suddenly leaving at the most enchanted moment. The film also thinks that we can't keep love fresh in marriage, daily bread, salt, sauce, vinegar and tea will certainly wear love to a thousand holes, so the hero and heroine decided only at this time, right now, only to talk about love and not the future, only to leave a person in each other's heart in the future, leaving a period of the past. But is this really not a pity? I think there will still be regrets, or there will be no next BEFORE SUNSETThe acme of all love, cannot peel off from regret and helpless. Love is like the choice of life, is plain peace of mind, or a lifetime of the sharp knife lick blood.

title: A Rare Jewel
content: This is like a romance, drama, and comedy all wrapped up in one. It's creative, charming and subtly hilarious through out. It's so deep in what it covers, while never feeling like a philosophy lecture. Almost nothing is cookie cutter.Both characters are interesting. I really can't think of any complaints. I was just smiling ear to ear as I watched it all go down. It's rare for me to enjoy a movie that much or to give something a 10/10 but this just wins.The pacing is pretty slow and steady so it may not be for everyone. Lots and lots of dialogue. It feels so timeless because of the setting and the storyline. Enjoy!

title: Total and utter nonsense.
content: I seldom write reviews but this movie was so bad it deserves a quick mention. I can't remember disliking a movie as much as I disliked this one. Irritating male lead, less than average acting, and zero chemistry between the main characters, even the camera work was just ok. But all this paled by comparison when it came to the dialogue. The wooden, pseudo Intellectual nonsense made this such a painful experience. I watched the first hour and finished it in sections in a vain effort to lessen the torture, but actually if felt like pulling a band aid off slowly. This is a film with no redeeming feature. Terrible, terrible movie.

title: Beautiful movie
content: Beautiful movie that captures such a rare but real connection between two people. It certainly puts your own relationship into context and makes you dream a little! The movie does not go over the top with romance, but there's certainly enough of it to make it special. The french accent will never cease to capture me. This movie can be watched by absolutely anyone, even the most manly of men. The only reason I awarded it 9 out of 10 and not 10 is because Ethan Hawke can, in my opinion, be a LITTLE bit cheesy at times, but it certainly didn't ruin anything! I'd give my left and right leg to swap positions with him! A must watch. Can't wait to see the sequels.

title: i need this travel thing
content: The connection between Céline and Jesse was adorable but movie's style is not for everyone. For me, it was amazing 😎

title: The chemistry was amazing between those actor, and musical score was at the same level...
content: The chemistry was amazing between those actor, and musical score was at the same level. Besides the chemistry also the interactions and conversations where believable.

title: Enchanting
content: I have never felt such a strong essence of a city from a film before, it just made me want to be there. The whole thing is just two characters talking to each other as they wonder aimlessly through Vienna and it's brilliant. You feel the carefree optimism of two young people taking a chance together. There is a sense of romance as the characters get closer mixed with the foreboding sense of their time ticking by. I loved these characters and love this film.

title: My Favorite Trilogy
content: The dialogue. THE DIALOGUE! Where do I even begin? Every single detail in this movie felt so effortlessly natural. There's no explosions or car chases, but I was absolutely glued to my screen for the films entire duration. In fact, I dont think I even blinked. I could watch this movie over and over and over again and I'd ever get bored. It really is that good. The fact that this wasn't nominated for any major awards is mind boggling. Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy are so perfectly casted. They fully embody the characters to the point where it feels more like a reality TV show than a fictional story.I'm really not the biggest fan of the romance genre because there's so many cheesy movies that honestly make me want to stay single forever. However, every once in awhile a movie like Before Sunrise is released and restores my hope in true love.Before Sunrise ranks amongst my favorite movies of all time. Please, if you havent already seen it, I beg you, WATCH IT NOW!!!

title: Stop talking, stop acting, go away!
content: This is one of those ideas that looks good on paper but is a gigantic bore on film. Bore? No, worse than that - major annoyance. You follow a couple through a day as they meet, become attracted to each other, walk around, talk, share ideas and experiences and feelings and experience love. Aww, ya can't not like that, right? Well, yes, you can. After half an hour I wanted to run out screaming. They may both be attractive young actors, but as time went on and I had to watch their faces FOREVER, without a break, without anything else breaking the focus, I couldn't stand seeing them any longer. And their voices, their voices! endlessly yakking away so earnestly, so incessantly, started to sound like fingernails scratching on a blackboard. I just wanted them to shut up. Then there was the look on their faces as the listened to each other, their faces responding to every nuance, listening so intently, so yearningly, with so much empathy and sympathy and understanding and two hearts beating as one ... Help! Let me out of here! Is this love? Sure, probably it is, but if it is, it's definitely something to be experienced, and enjoyed as a participant, not watched as an outsider, especially not watched so long and so closely as this movie forced you to do. You know when lovers call each other "pookie" and "snookums" and "koochie," how it's terribly affectionate and heartfelt and meaningful to them but you want to retch and just get away as fast as you can? That's how this film affected me. I still shiver at the thought of it. I'm not sure I'll be able to enjoy another movie with either of these actors in it.

title: my all time favorite
content: I love this movie, and not only because i lived in vienna 15 ys, walked through the city like them a million times, and made lots of train trips in austria. i love it because of its emotions, the simplicity, the juvenileness, the timelesness, the script and of course because of the two super cute leading roles

title: VERY UNIQUE ROMANTIC MOVIE
content: To be honest, I've never heard of this film, that's why I'm so obsessed with the movie themed Streets through the city at night, until I came across because a movie called Before We Go, I really liked that movie.It turns out that there are many reviews that say that this film was inspired by the film entitled Before Sunrise, so I did a search on this kind of genre film and it turned out to be there.I feel very happy that I'm not the only one who likes this Walk-and-Talk genre film, it turns out that a lot of people like it too.Okay, moving on to the discussion of the film, many say that Before Sunrise has popularized this genre, I am even more excited to watch it, that's right, this film is very good at presenting this genre.The plot presented is fairly simple, there is no conflict where one of the characters looks more powerful and becomes the main star in this film.Celine and Jesee really look like two people who have just met, the shyness and hidden love can be seen on their faces.The conversations they have are also fairly good, they are able to provide background and problems that they are facing but make a real impression because they say it shyly.I admire the acting of Ethan Hawke and Julie Deply who are able to do a lot of long dialogues with one Take, Thanks to this moment this film really feels real.The camera angle does not change (especially on the Street Running Train), there is no music, the quiet sound of the surrounding environment is really able to make the audience as people who are watching a pair of lovers talking each other.I think this film is very beautiful, you will not find a film like this, Until Before We Go was release which was inspired by the film Before The Sunrise.Also the ending of this film is very beautiful, the ending gives clear information that this film will have a sequel. And even now this film has become a Trology.That's my little review of this film, I hope this can be an encouragement for you to watch this film (for those of you who haven't watched it but are looking for a review first.That's it from me, Bucek Alexsander.Cheers.

title: Great
content: A masterpiece, one of the best romantic films that deserves your time for the entire series, but this first part remains the best ever.A complete work that does not have any defects, a masterpiece that must be seen.

title: Beautiful
content: This is the first movie where I've been genuinely interested in each and every conversation during monologues. And even better, there were multiple times where I was grasped by the things they discussed because it was so beautifully portrayed. I just loved how they bounced ideas with each other and discussed important questions about life.I usually find it hard to maintain focus, especially during long conversations in movies, but that wasn't the case here and that alone is a good score. This is a kind of movie that sticks around for a couple of days in your thoughts I think. Maybe even longer, we'll see.

title: Don't waste your time
content:
That movie was a waste of time. I did not simply not liked it, I despised it. I've never seen anything as pompous for absolutely no reason. Both characters are cliches in everything they are
The dialogues are everything the movie is based on, and yet they are nothing more than "pick-me" quintessence. Additionally, calling them "dialogues" is an insult to what a proper dialogue actually is; the characters don't go as far as having an actual conversation, they simply say the most random things, almost as if they were not even listening to the other one. I sincerely suffered this movie and did not get anything positive (or even new) out of it.

title: Utterly charming
content: "I believe if there's any kind of God it wouldn't be in any of us, not you or me but just this little space in between. If there's any kind of magic in this world it must be in the attempt of understanding someone sharing something. I know, it's almost impossible to succeed but who cares really? The answer must be in the attempt."Utterly charming. A brilliant script, touching on so many things about life and relationships, and acted so naturally by Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy that it often seems like they're improvising. The story is perfectly crafted and told by Linklater. Easily one of my all-time favorite romantic films. I could watch these two walk around Vienna and connect for another ten hours.

title: One of the greatest screen romance
content: Essentially a 100min dialogue with a pretty background but one of the greatest screen romance

title: Walk and talk wow
content:
Uttermost beauty lies in walk and talkFilm : Before Sunrise
Director : Richard Linklater
Cinematography : Lee Daniel
Music : Fred Faith
Cast : @delpy.julie @ethanhawkeWhile watching the journey of Jesse and Celine, I just wanted to pack my travel kit jump out from the window, catch a train going too far (somewhere) there supposed to meet a strange girl like celine
Wanna Start a endless conversations discussions debate's exchanging thoughts
Respecting eachother tastes, then want to remind her about this before triology...apart from don't know where it's taking to me !!#beforesunrise nothing but like having 100 min sex with Lips and Feets.#richardlinklater @kimkrizan celebration of love and romance which offer's Beats throbs with the stolen looks brief touches stardust kisses. I always believe conversations are better than sex that exactly what these two guys did.#ethanhawke #juliedelpy soulful portrayal by Sharing the great moments together.#leedaniel manages to capture natural beauty of Vienna elagently without seeming superfluous.There's hell of good scenes will pickup one my favourite scene " where jeese and Celine sitting on a restaurant, make a fake phone calls to friends once the back home describes one another to imaginary voices at the end of their imaginary phones".It's a bittersweet
celebration of love and romance !!

title: Before Sunrise
content: Amazing movie, a guy will never get tired of watching. Recommended!!!

title: A Poetic Journey of Connection and Conversation
content: Before Sunrise is a beautifully understated exploration of love, connection, and the fleeting nature of time. Directed by Richard Linklater, this 1995 classic takes a simple premise-a chance meeting between two strangers-and transforms it into an unforgettable cinematic experience.The film follows Jesse (Ethan Hawke), an American, and Céline (Julie Delpy), a Frenchwoman, who meet on a train to Vienna. Deciding to spend one night together walking through the city before Jesse's flight the next morning, their time unfolds as a series of heartfelt and intellectual conversations about life, love, and their differing perspectives on the world. The chemistry between Hawke and Delpy is nothing short of electric, making their characters' connection feel deeply authentic and relatable.What sets Before Sunrise apart is its authenticity. The dialogue feels natural and unforced, capturing the spontaneity and vulnerability of two people getting to know each other. Linklater's direction allows the story to breathe, letting the characters' words and emotions take center stage. Every moment feels intimate, as if the audience is eavesdropping on something deeply personal and real.The setting of Vienna is another star of the film. The city's quiet streets, scenic parks, and atmospheric cafés provide a dreamlike backdrop for Jesse and Céline's budding romance. The cinematography is subtle yet stunning, capturing the beauty of their surroundings without overshadowing the story.At its core, Before Sunrise is about human connection. It's a film that resonates deeply, reminding viewers of the magic that can occur when two souls meet at the right moment in time. The movie doesn't rely on grand gestures or dramatic twists-instead, it finds its power in the small, meaningful exchanges that define relationships.Before Sunrise is a timeless masterpiece, celebrating the joy and melancholy of fleeting moments. It's a film that stays with you, not just for its story, but for how it makes you feel-hopeful, introspective, and profoundly moved.

title: One of the best romantic movies ever ...
content: There is not much that can be said about this movie that was not said before. Linklater has accomplished the impossible and has landed 2 of his movies (Dazed and Confused and Before Sunrise) in my Top 10 list of favorite movies.This movie is quite frankly one of the most overlooked gems of modern cinema. I am a guy, 32, and have seen this movie at least over a dozen times and has always left me with a teary eye. Julie Delpy is like and angel from heaven that has unsuspectedly landed in Ethan Hawke's life and ours. All the key scenes have been mentioned before, the record shop listening booth (this one had to be improvised, as I don't think this is possible to be pulled of by the most talented of actors), the imaginary phone calls, the kiss on top of the Prater, the talk about having/not having sex. The sadness of the empty spaces without them at the end ...Maybe it has more meaning for me than for others as my ex-girlfriend looked like Delpy somewhat and out last encounter was in an airport under similar circumstances and promises as the ending of the movie, but this is a definite recommendation for anyone that thrives on that great feeling when you have with someone that just invades your soul and you want to spend every waking moment with them. Kudos for Linklater for being able to capture this so faithfully and unpretentiously. A once in a lifetime achievement! One of the best films ever!

title: I fell in love with this film
content: This is one of the most romantic movies I've ever watched. It's so real to me, the way the two characters, meet, talk, and fell in love with each other. It's very simply and sincere. It's like watching some special moments in time in the life of two people, who may or may not going to meet each other again. Some people say that a movie shouldn't base on dialog, but I think this one is an exception. The realistic dialog and acting really grips my attention and pull me in. I felt like I was watching two people falling in love.I know that people can view this differently. Some may say that it's impossible that such a thing can happen and two people are talking this way. But what I want to say is, this thing can happen and two people can talk this way.The film even reminds of some experience that I had in my real life.For me, the timing of this film is just perfect. The music used is just right and fit in with the mood of the film. The cinematography captures the romantic atmosphere of Vienna. I've got my favorite scenes and I can watch this movie over and over again. It will surely stay in my heart.Thanks to the director for creating such a unique and magnificent piece of work. Never watch anything like it.

title: Engaging, charming, delightful, and real.
content: Linklater's film reminds me of a professional sports performance: he makes it look so easy! The sense of ease and delight, the languid pace and rich dialogue are not for everyone. These are largely intellectual charms we are offered as we sit at one remove, voyeurs after all, and watch romantic love spark and catch fire.This is a love story that sets us free to witness a very real world, slightly overwrought, charmingly self-conscious, and entirely engaging. It feels like a real-time record of a first meeting and the non-stop conversation that ensues, the kind every thinking person has enjoyed at some point and remembers with sweet nostalgia.The sex is all in the words, deeply embedded and all the more passionate for the energetic connection between the two main characters. Idealism, youth, and naiveté engage levels of honesty and courage rarely seen on film, expertly rendered by two actors willing to bring more of themselves into the frame.Relax and enjoy - this film will invoke your best memories of youthful idealism and the deep joy of sharing ideas, however briefly, with another person.

title: superb, one of the best romantic films ever made!
content: One of the best romantic films I've ever seen. This movie portrays in a simple but well done way how the life of two strangers changes after spending one complete day in Vienna.Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy are just great, their characters are so well matched that the dialogues and performances look just natural in such a way that you can even feel identified with both of them. Even though when the story seems to be simple, the extraordinary dialogues and the beautiful European sceneries and the marvellous music make of it an enjoyable film, a magical an original love story different form what I've seen before.

title: How did I miss this movie the first time?
content: I can't believe none of my friends told me about this wonderful movie back in 1995. OK, I'm not usually into romance/love stories (aside from Casablanca, Brief Encounter, and Now Voyager -- all right, maybe I *am* into them), but this one is different. You don't feel like you're watching a movie, the dialog rings so true. And the scene where they make their pretend phone calls -- top 10 movie scenes of all time. Next time you watch this movie, watch them watching each other. Their relationship grows so subtly that you don't realize how into each other they are becoming. What is it about trains and lovers and Europe? Linklater found the perfect story and location and actors. What more do you want? Please, give this one a chance.

title: We are all stardust
content: Everyone I've asked has maintained the sequel to Before Sunrise is superior. I disagree. Perhaps they related to Jesse and Celine later in their lives, or maybe they just prefer Paris to Vienna. In baseball, however, when the ball and the runner reach the base at the same time, the tie goes to the runner. In the case of originals and sequels, ceteras para bus, the tie should go to the original: without it, there would be no sequel. The characters, the tone and the structure were developed in Sunrise first. I suppose this is the place where I would review the film, but it seems unfair to divulge any of the lovely secrets embedded in almost each scene, lest the reader hasn't seen the film. You really ought to discover these things on your own. But for what they are  well-plotted, exceptionally well-written conversations perfectly synthesized by the actors and shot in a glorious cinematic style  these films are perfect. Frost once wrote that great art came from freedom within the reins. Linklater adheres to this, allowing his premise to guide him. THe result is his films never try to be too much, yet they build tension like no Michael Bay film.

title: A well-done film
content: This is an extremely well-done film about an experience everyone has -- or should have -- had in their lives. If you don't find a bit of yourself in either of these two people, you have a cold heart. The dialogue is intelligently written but it's the acting and the delivery of such realistic repartee between two people that makes this movie exceptional. Nothing is forced or stilted, everything true and situationally apropos, from the way they nervously play with the S&P shakers on the train to their discussion about whether or not to have sex. Many touching and poignant moments -- but never overly sentimental or trite.A bit slow in places, but that's its only downside and possibly serves to make it even more realistic, as life does have its slow moments. But if you like character studies about the self-conscious and intricate dances we perform with new relationships, like "Lost in Translation" or "Sideways," you will find this movie extremely rewarding. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm on my way over to Netflix to order "Before Sunset." And if you have never had the bittersweet and life-altering experience of a fleeting romance with a total stranger, get yourself to Vienna. Pronto.

title: yadda, yadda, yadda . . .
content: Before Sunrise is an exceptionally boring movie. It stars Julie Delpy and Ethan Hawke as a couple people who meet on a train, spend the night wandering through Vienna, and then go their separate ways at sunrise. I have to admit that there are moments that feel very genuine, and it seems more realistic and heartfelt than most romance movies. The problem is that you have to hear these two people talk, and talk, and talk for an hour and forty-five minutes and neither of them has anything interesting to say. You get to hear Hawke's ideas about reincarnation and Delpy's story about going into therapy after breaking up from a boyfriend she didn't like that much anyway, and yadda, yadda, yadda, blah, blah, blah . . . I wanted to shoot myself in the head.

title: Ordinary people, extraordinary emotions
content: I saw "Before sunrise" first time about five years ago in Finnish television. I watched it because it got really good review in a local newspaper. Thanks to reviewer for emphasizing the greatness of this movie - otherwise I may have never seen it."Before sunrise" really stamped its mark into my mind. As I said it has been something like five years now since I first saw it. During the years I forgot most of the films plot but still remembered how strongly it had touched me at one time.About a week ago I found a copy of "Before sunrise" in a shelf in library and lent it. I had tried to find it from video stores few times but hadn't succeed. I watched it three times during the weekend and I have to point out that this film is even greater than I remembered it to be. It's a little story about two quite ordinary people getting to know, like and love each other. It's about two everyday people - you or me, anyone of us - sitting in a train, walking in streets and doing basically nothing exceptional, and still it avoids being banal nor boring in any way. Its strength is in its realism; everything Celine and Jesse do and say is captured to a tape in so natural way. Identifying yourself with the characters is inevitable. Ending is perfect - it makes a watcher to continue the film in his/hers own mind as he/she likes and so the movie keeps one in tight grip long after it has ended. I suppose that experiencing a love bigger than life is a fantasy number 1 for most people and describing that fantasy is what this film does without doing a single mistake.I love "Before sunrise". It hasn't any special effects or unbelievable turns in a plot but it has touched my heart deeper than any other film before (sunrise, sunset or whatever, ha ha), and I think that it's all that matters in a subjective level. The stronger emotional experience a movie gives, the higher I rank it. I'm sure there's a lot of people out there who can enjoy "Before sunrise" as much as I did (and do) if they just give it a chance. On the other hand I'm afraid that people who are totally happy with their lives won't enjoy this film so much. It requires some kind of miserable mentality combined to hopes for better times."Before sunrise" is a film that uses little maneuvers in portraying big emotions. It makes me feel like it could be me on the screen. I hope that some day I have a chance to love some woman as much as I love this film.Fantastic piece of art.

title: Great film, commended!
content: Well, I just also saw this film on a late evening (accidentally!!) few years ago...well but it just anchored in my mind since then.  The story was simple, and virtually only TWO actors...but impressing after all.I encountered it eventually in the shop and bought it immediately TODAY!! I saw it again....impressing.  For those haven't seen it, highly recommended. Story.....well about 2 people encountered in the train, then started a short night gathering...which they're bound to leave each other by next morning....may never see each other again in their whole life.  Well in short, see it!

title: One of the most thoughtful and honest romantic movies I've seen.
content: I found Before Sunrise by chance when it was first released on video a few years ago.  Watching it then, I felt it was a well-written movie and an event that I would one day hope to experience myself.  Watching it now as a person in my young/mid twenties, I realize that I've experienced a feeling very similar to this movie: Being independent and actually falling in love.That experience was brief, honest, and fulfilling, leaving an impression on me that I'll always remember.  This film generates those same feelings for me, and watching this movie after my own experience, I can only see myself in Jesse's place, living out my own similar situations.This movie is one of the finest, most underappreciated (in my opinion) romantic stories of the '90's.  It's a very real movie, and it's an accurate portrayal of what it feels like to meet someone who you just instantly "click" with.  No gripping score, no dramatic good-bye only to be "surprise" reunited at the end.  Before Sunrise portrays all of its messages with the sincere awkwardness of a beginning relationship, a bit of insightful conversation, and two people with similar views and interests finding each other.Delpy and Hawke don't play stereotypes in this movie.  They play people, and that's what makes this film so interesting.  The pacing of the film is slow, yet time seems to rush by.  These are people you could actually meet.  These people could actually be you.When Before Sunrise ends, there's no contrived, cheesy good-bye, it just ends, which is how life works.  It leaves the possibilities open, but not in the way that you could see a sequel being made. If anyone has ever felt like this in a relationship, this movie will never ring truer than it does.  For those who have yet to find that bit of spontaneous adventure, Before Sunrise is a good guide of what to look for.I can't recommend this movie highly enough.  An intelligent, inspiring film.

title: Amazingly involving
content: This movie is about a short but strong relationship between 2 strangers. The location is unique and spectacular. The actors are amazing, both Hawke and Delpy are absolutely believable. The writing is sooooo damn natural and realistic you forget it's a movie - instead YOU will have a relationship with either Hawke or Delpy (depending on how you're inclined).This movie is a MUST for all hopeless romantics! Although most of it is just these 2 conversing among themselves, that for me was the BEST aspect of this movie. Movies like these show us once again (as many of us have forgotten) the raw power of a beautiful film. By the end you will have been through the relationship yourself and feel the same mixed feelings of contentment, sadness, exhaustion and whatever else the actors are supposed to be feeling. RENT THIS ONE NOW!!!  TRUST ME, YOU DON'T WANT TO MISS IT!

The Before trilogy is one of the best trilogies ever made in cinema. The only better trilogy is the LOTR trilogy. All movies present a one-day setting of the romance between Jesse (Ethan Hawke) and Celine (Julie Delpy). Set in different locations and chapters of their relationship. This movie focuses on their first encounter in Vienna. Director Richard Linklater made sure each film was unique with its style of dialogue, cinematography, and locations. But what all movies have in common is the excellent dialogue that feels so real, almost at the same level as Noah Baumbach's writing.The film's dialogue focuses on them knowing each other and not sure where the conversation will lead them in the future. Like many opportunities are opened. This reflects the random locations throughout the film, showing how our two characters also explore their relationship. The two main casts in this film are purely natural with their roles. My other reviews for the sequels are mostly the same. The movie may have a simple premise of how they fall in love, but what makes the Before trilogy is the details of what can happen in one day. I have given you three recommendations if you want to watch a love movie.

title: The Best...
content: O.K in a word: The Best! I'm a total movie freak and I have seen, belive me , A LOT of movies! But this movie beats them all! Before Sunrise is everything you can hope from a movie it makes you laugh and it makes you cry and it's a brilliant combination of good script and great actors! The script couldn't be more simple, everyday conversations and jokes that you've already heard! But the way it's made alive, The beautiful nightly Vienna is a perfect place for this movie to be filmed and Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy fit perfectly to their roles as Jesse and Celine! I have seen this movie about ten times and it just gets better every time I see it again! If you haven't seen this movie by now I suggest that you run straight to your local video store and rent it, I guarantee that you'll love it!By the way Ich möchte deine Hand lesen...

title: Gag them with a spoon
content: One of the most difficult scenes in acting is when a fictitious character is to naturally recount an old memory.  Often in dramatics, an actor tells of some old memory with just a hint of averted eyes and awkward facial expressions.  It is difficult to act out the natural timing of facial expressions as a person taps their own memory.  In real life, we all do this with ease with our true memories.  But actors in a movie are dealing with make-believe, so there is nothing in their brains to be retrieved and it is very easy to see through the acting.From beginning to end, BEFORE SUNRISE is a movie with two main characters who do almost nothing but recount to each other happenings from their individual pasts.  Unfortunately, the actors are not up to this difficult task.Apparently, most of these many strolls down memory lane are meant to end with some clever insight on humanity.  About one in one hundred succeeds.There is no catchy music, no passion, and very little to maintain interest. The viewer's mind begins to ponder side items, such as the facial structure of the actors chosen for this movie.  The lead actor and actress have the same nose and chin and eyes.  They could be brother and sister.  And the palm reader looked to be the mother of the lead actress.Last, the script has some unmissable glitches.  The audience that was around me murmured much disapproval during the bar scene when the bar owner and the lead actor shake hands on a deal in which the bar owner would give the lead actor the mailing address to the bar so that the lead actor can later mail payment for wine given out.  Just when we expect the address to be given, the lead actor walks away and he and the bar owner act as if the deal never happened.The characters learn about each other in an impractical backwards manner in terms of the science of mating.  No digits are exchanged.  No addresses or such personal data perhaps only because the script gives highest priority to the retelling of old memories -- old memories that are fake.  Unsatisfying. Unentertaining.

title: Great Movie
content: Haven studied in Europe for two times in the late 60's and early 70's, this movie really struck home -- the fast trains, great geography, little towns, fantastic scenery overall.  Combine this with the moving story of two students meeting by accident made this an over the top movie for me.  Highly recommended.

title: My favorite film
content: Delpy and Hawke combine, perfectly I might add, to make one of the most endearing couples I've ever watched. I fell in love with Celine, just as Jesse did. I loved the dialogue. I loved the characters. I loved the subtlety of their journey. This is my favorite film.

title: Unforgettable
content: Over the last three years or so I saw this movie several times. Although there is no obvious plot, it keeps drawing the viewers attention.This is the most beautiful movie ever made.

title: Not Your Run of the Mill Romance
content: Very boring in some places, a little corny in others, and sort of awkward in yet other parts. But overall, this movie charmed the very essence of the romance genre to a whole level. Although the entire movie is one long, drawn-out conversation, it cites philosophical and universally deep material that makes the viewer question his/her own relationships and pursuits. From beginning to end, this film attempts and succeeds admirably in capturing the timeless ritual of fundamental human interaction and courtship. Decent acting, amazing scenery, and an illustrious script all cooperate to make this movie a revitalizing breath of fresh air to romance watchers tired of stale, overused plots and predictable characters and stories. From its mundane beginning to its unique and worthwhile ending, Before Sunrise will have its loyal viewers aching for more, and its disappointed viewers at least thinking, in the back of their minds, about the meanings of their own lives.

title: Unpretentious romance between two young people.
content: This is a lovely film about two young people (Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy) who meet by chance on the Eurostar and decide to spend an evening together before going their separate ways. It has no plot (in the mainstream sense), but don't let that deter you. The whole film is spent following the young couple around the city of Venice, whilst they talk about such subjects as reincarnation, ex- girlfriends/boyfriends, sex, politics, religion and love.

title: In my top 5 list
content: This has to be one of the best romantic comedies I've ever experienced. The scene in the record store has to be my favourite, I'm not giving anything away, if you've seen the movie you understand what I'm talking about.  The ending was exceptional, it's a movie that actually makes you wonder what happens after it ends.  The cinimatography was beautiful, the acting was wonderful, they worked so well together.  There is no hard core action, no nudity, no guns, no violence, only plot and dialogue, but the dialogue is the best I have experienced in a long while.

title: i hate him
content: That's it. I think the story had great potential but his character was horrible, he was a big red flag the entire movie. I liked the poem guy that was in it for two minutes more than i liked him. She is awesome and gorgeous and he sucks.

title: The best "cinema" of 1995
content: Out of 350 films that I had managed to see that year, "Before Sunrise" caught my attention, imagination and passion for the true cinematic art. It rose above the other entries of the year to stand out as my number one pick of 1995.The thought of finding oneself in a foreign country and discovering the country with a beautiful stranger is a fantasy I think many people can relate to and wish upon themselves. The exotic location of Vienna is a perfect setting for the adventures of two university students meeting up during the last days of their summer vacation. Their discovery of each other is matched beautifully with the sights and scenes of the city, getting wonderful vistas as the couple walks around discovering tings about themselves, each other, and the world that they have been born into.Obviously what makes this film work is the chemistry between the actors. Them seem genuinely interested in each other and throughout the film you want to learn more about them and hope that there is some foreshadowing of what might happen to them in the coming years. But, until 2004, all you had was the 105 mins of them together, walking and talking through the streets. Some might consider this to be a boring way to spend their time, but I think being within the age group of the actors I could relate to many of their conversations and ideals. SO very few films these days are dialogue driven so this was a very refreshing treat indeed.I have seen this film about 5 times and it was like rediscovering it each time. Only the last time did it seem to lose a bit of it's mystery when I knew that it's sequel "Before Sunset" was being released this summer. And as you may have already guessed it's sequel is currently in the running for my favorite picture of the year.

title: The most giving romance I have ever seen on screen
content: What could easily have ended up as a boring, or all-to-sweet tasteless farce keeps the nerve all the way to the last second... a partly American film, WITH AN INTELLIGENT ENDING!! Watched it with my girlfriend... didn't regret it.

title: Beautiful!
content: Before Sunrise is one of my favorite movies! Why? Because it reminds me of falling in love, - 'even if you both shall die when the morning comes...' The dialogue between Delphy and Hawke does sometimes sound more like poetry than conversation! And of course because it takes place in beautiful Vienna!

title: straight romance
content: This movie is the purest form of romance. No comedy or drama, just straight boy-meets-girl. It's entertaining and occasionally quite funny, but it won't work for you unless you are a romantic at heart. The movie is very sweet, has no plot, and is the most gentle picture I can recall at the moment. Nothing even slightly scary happens, and other than a little mild necking, there isn't any sex in it, either. I guess that Ethan Hawke is cute (I'll ask my wife), Julie Delpy is quite beautiful in the movie, and both of the characters are extremely likable.This is a normal Linklater movie, which means that it's about people instead of plot, so if you like his other movies you really should give this one a try.

title: A romantic movie for the thinking man and woman
content: I hadn't heard of "Before Sunrise", until the sequel "Before Sunset" was released. Because there was quite some hype around the sequel and the first one was broad-casted a few days later, I gave it a try. At first I wasn't too convinced about this movie's quality, but I kept watching it anyway and gradually I started to like it more and more. I guess this is the kind of movie that you have to see a couple of times before you can like it at its fullest."Before Sunrise" tells the story of a French graduate student named Celine (Julie Delpy) who meets a young American named Jesse (Ethan Hawke) on the Budapest-Vienna train. She is returning to Paris and he's making a trip through Europe. But instead of continuing their trip on their own, they decide to get of the train in Vienna, where they will spend the entire day and night together. During their stay of 14 hours, they get to know the city and each other, but when the night ends and another day begins, they have to say goodbye to each other, not knowing if they will ever meet again...This isn't yet another romantic movie based on the all too known concept of boy meets girl, boy and girl have a fight, boy and girl realize they love each other too much and live happily ever after. I guess you could call this a romantic movie for the thinking man and woman. This isn't just a corny flick, but a very intelligent and beautiful movie that will offer you the chance to really get to know its characters in a profound way.Overall this is a romantic movie with a well written story, interesting characters and of course a beautiful city as a setting. What more could you possibly expect? Not much, and that's why I give this movie at least a 7.5/10.

title: Great Movie.......
content: I saw this late at night about 7 years ago. I'm not going to tell you the ending, but it does leave you hanging. Very few movies can pull that off without leaving a bad taste in your mouth, but this one does. Not to fear though, just last week I heard their finally going to do a segual to this *10 love story!!!

title: Beauty is in simplicity
content: I've seen this film six years ago and I saw it couple of days ago, again. Just like the first time, I felt such a delight and I wondered if anyone else felt the same way (because we are used to watch over media exposed and overrated and often pretentious  Hollywood movies - O.K it is not that I don't like watching many of them). That's why I for the first time started to read user comments and for this film only. I was surprised how many people from over the Globe share the same or similar feeling and insight about it. But, now, it seems to me so normal. The beauty is in simplicity. This is the most beautiful romance movie ever, because there is nothing too much but everything enough. That everything is  just that pure first emotion of newborn love, it's blossom and acknowledgement that it must end soon.

title: Great movie, gets better every time I see it
content: This is a movie which to me brings out the best and worst in Film Making today. Actually it is truly more of a film than a movie.The best? That movies like this can be made.; The worst? Unfortunately very few people see it and it receives no award recognition. After seeing this movie, who would not say that it was not deserving of Oscar nominations (For Director, Film, Actor and Actress). But I know why: it is too intelligent and too sensitive.I think all of us can relate to Jesse and Celine. I think we all have had a similar experience (maybe not with Vienna as a background) in that we met somebody (not always as a love interest) we liked the person, we talked and then we move on. Our lives are changed just a little by the encounter/relationship and we often wondered what happened to the person.I have recommended this film to many people. For one exception (and even that person re-thought it afterwards and changed their mind)everyone has said WOW and really liked it. Alas, everybody sees the same thing in the ending as me: . But to me, that is what makes the movie so special. Jesse and Celine are changed forever by their time BEFORE SUNRISE but will never meet again. Sad but realistic; sad but true. You can see it in each of their final expressions in the movie. A smile and then they close their eyes; their time  together is already becoming a memory.Other than the ending, the scene in which they are in a bar and in which they have a telephone conversation with their friends is one of the most magical scenes I have ever seen in a movie. It was great and gets better each time I view the movie.This is a terrific film. We need more movies like this; but maybe what makes the movie so special is that we have too few movies like this - that is why I enjoy it so much. I read in one review that maybe a sequel would be in the works; I hope not as that would ruin the one thing about BEFORE SUNRISE that sets it apart: that Jesse and Celine will never meet again. And in all honesty, they never do.So, here's to Jesse and Celine; let's hope  they both have found happiness.

title: Wonderful Film
content: Don't watch this film expecting any action (physical or mechanical). This is simple a film about two strangers on train who meet and take a chance on getting to know one and another. Most of the film involves this couples conversations as they spend one night together walking the streets of Paris. Well written, very involving.

title: unforgettable
content: I saw this movie on release and fell in love with it. It's a film with a lot of talking (but then, so are Tarantino's) yet never feels 'talky'. It's heartbreaking, though ultimately - because we have been party to a compassionate work of art - uplifting.
